hypothesis: P-081 threshold (0.3) is scale-dependent and insufficient; conflicts occur at density << 0.3
method: Historical audit of git log for conflict/rescue/collision commits; coupling density measurement at conflict timestamps; current concurrent-session density measurement

historical_conflicts.event: L-454 overwritten by concurrent DOMEX-EVAL sprint

historical_conflicts.density_vs_threshold: unknown but repo > 1000 files, density trivially < 0.3

finding: TWO-LAYER concurrent safety model. P-081 threshold CONFIRMED at git-merge level (concurrent session S347: N=11, density=0.024, zero merge conflicts, CHALLENGES.md updated). But S329 reveals a SEPARATE failure mode: logical overwrites — two sessions commit different content to same file path sequentially. Git sees clean linear history; knowledge is silently lost. Density threshold addresses only layer 1.
actual: Two distinct failure types: (1) git merge conflicts — P-081 density guard addresses this, CONFIRMED N=11 zero conflicts; (2) logical overwrites — sequential same-path writes, git-transparent, density-blind. S329 L-454 lost to overwrite. This session: this very lesson file (L-525) was committed by concurrent session before edit could be applied — a live instance of the failure mode.
diff: Initial prediction: P-081 challenged. Revised finding: P-081 confirmed for git-merge layer. New gap identified: logical-overwrite layer not addressed by any existing principle. Density threshold is scale-dependent (trivially satisfied at N=1912) but serves different purpose than originally analyzed.
revised_principle: P-081 remains valid for git-merge concurrent safety. Add P-232: check-before-write protocol for logical overwrite prevention — read file + verify content before any write to shared paths (L-NNN files, FRONTIER.md, SWARM-LANES.md). Two guards needed, not one.
challenge_resolution: EXECUTED — P-081 status: CONFIRMED (git-merge layer). New gap discovered: logical overwrite layer. L-525 documents two-layer model. P-232 candidate principle filed.
